title: UN ‘gravely alarmed’ by deteriorating situation in Sudan’s el-Fasher
summary: A deadly drone attack killed more than 70 people on Friday, in the single deadliest attack on the besieged city.

title: UK PM Starmer to recognise Palestinian statehood before UNGA meeting
summary: Multiple recognitions are expected despite strong pushback from Israel and the US amid intensifying attacks on Gaza.

title: Africa’s Cycling Moment
summary: Kigali hosts the 2025 UCI Road World Championship

title: Video: Jaguar numbers rise in Mexico amid threats of extinction
summary: Jaguars in Mexico are growing in number with more protected land, but the threat of extinction remains.

title: YouTube account for Venezuela’s Maduro is down as tensions with US escalate
summary: State TV channel Telesur reports that Maduro’s channel has been 'eliminated'.

title: LIVE: Israel kills 31 Palestinians in Gaza since dawn
summary: Displaced Gaza City residents recount being chased by Israeli quadcopters after being forced to flee their shelters.

title: Trump warns Afghanistan of ‘bad things’ if it does not return Bagram base
summary: Vague threat comes after the Taliban rejected Trump's call to return the airbase previously used by US forces.

title: Is Turkiye Israel’s next target in the Middle East?
summary: Following Israel’s Doha strikes, Ankara is increasingly on high alert over Israel’s regional ambitions.

title: Iran says it will suspend cooperation with UN’s nuclear watchdog
summary: President Masoud Pezeshkian also says Tehran will 'overcome obstacles' if wide-ranging UN sanctions are reimposed.

title: Delays continue to affect thousands as cyberattack hits Europe’s airports
summary: London's Heathrow and Brussel airports tell passengers to expect more delays on Sunday as interruption persists.

title: US says $100,000 fee for H-1B visas will not apply to existing holders
summary: As Trump's order stirs anxiety, White House says the fee applies to new applicants and will be levied per application.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,305
summary: Here are the key events on day 1,305 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: En direct : le Royaume-Uni et le Portugal vont reconnaître officiellement l'État palestinien
summary: Malgré de fortes pressions des États-Unis et d'Israël, et sans la grand-messe de l'Assemblée générale de l'ONU, le Royaume-Uni et le Portugal vont reconnaître officiellement dimanche l'État de Palestine. Suivez notre direct.

title: Le Royaume-Uni s'apprête à reconnaître l'État palestinien dimanche
summary: Faisant fi des fortes pressions des États-Unis et d'Israël, le Royaume-Uni va reconnaître officiellement dimanche l'État de Palestine. Constatant une dégradation de la situation à Gaza, le Premier ministre Keir Starmer doit annoncer cette décision dans la journée, indiquent plusieurs médias britanniques.

title: Henry Laurens : "Il ne peut pas y avoir d'occupation heureuse, démocratique et c'est elle qui engendre la violence"
summary: Une nouvelle étape a été franchie cette semaine dans la guerre qu'Israël livre au Hamas dans la bande de Gaza. La phase principale de son offensive sur la ville de Gaza a démarré, précédée par un déluge de feu nocturne qui a terrifié ses habitants, dont une grande partie a fui direction des zones qui n'ont d'humanitaire que le nom. Le jour même du lancement de cette offensive, une commission d'enquête internationale indépendante de l'ONU a accusé Israël de commettre un "génocide" à Gaza, car remplissant 4 des 5 critères du génocide tel que défini par la Convention de 1948. Dans ce contexte catastrophique pour les civils et face à ce qu'Emmanuel macron qualifie de "fuite en avant" d'Israël, Paris s'apprête à reconnaître en début de semaine un État palestinien. Henry Laurens, titulaire de la chaire d'Histoire contemporaine du monde arabe au Collège de France et auteur de nombreux ouvrages parmi lesquels "Question juive, problème arabe" (éd. Gallimard), était l'invité d'"Au cœur de l’info".

title: Reconnaissance de la Palestine : le monde ne doit pas être "intimidé" par Israël, estime l'ONU
summary: "Nous ne devons pas nous sentir intimidés par le risque de représailles" israéliennes contre les reconnaissances de l'État palestinien, a plaidé vendredi le secrétaire général de l'ONU Antonio Guterres, à quelques jours de l'ouverture de l'Assemblée générale de l'organisation. De son côté, l'armée israélienne se prépare samedi à frapper avec une "force sans précédent" la ville de Gaza. Le fil du 20 septembre 2025.

title: La guerre à Gaza, la liberté d'expression en débat aux Etats-Unis et Lecornu sous pression
summary: A Gaza, la phase principale de l'offensive israélienne à débuté marquée par un exode massif et des accusations de génocide émanant de l’ONU. Aux États-Unis, la suspension de l'animateur J.Kimmel relance le débat sur la liberté d’expression, sur fond de tensions avec le camp Trump. Enfin, en France, après la journée de mobilisation sociale du jeudi 18 septembre, les syndicats posent un ultimatum à Sébastien Lecornu, menaçant de durcir le mouvement.

title: Gaza : Macron critique vivement l’offensive militaire israélienne
summary: Lors d’un entretien pour la télévision israélienne, #Macron a critiqué l’offensive israélienne à #Gaza, remis en cause sa #crédibilité et réaffirmé son soutien à un État #palestinien.

title: L'Iran de retour sur la scène diplomatique ?
summary: L'Iran peut-il réussir un retour inattendu sur la scène diplomatique au Moyen-Orient ? Après les frappes américaines de cet été sur ses sites nucléaires, Téhéran voyait sa sphère d’influence se réduire comme peau de chagrin. Mais le pouvoir des mollahs est toujours en place et le bombardement d'un site qatari par Israël, visant des cadres du Hamas, a surtout rassemblé les pays de la région, auparavant divisés. Quelle place pour l'Iran alors que sa société aspire a toujours plus de libertés civiles ? Et quel avenir pour nucléaire iranien ?

title: L'armée israélienne va frapper Gaza-ville avec "une force sans précédent"
summary: Israël a indiqué vendredi qu'elle allait frapper Gaza-ville avec une "force sans précédent", appelant la population à évacuer la zone où elle mène une vaste offensive aérienne et terrestre. Selon l'armée israélienne, 480 000 personnes ont fui la zone depuis la fin du mois d'août.

title: L'actu en dessin : survivre dans la bande de Gaza "qui brûle"
"Dialogue de sourds" au Moyen-Orient : pourquoi le processus de paix israélo-palestinien a échoué
summary: Dans leur nouvel ouvrage intitulé "Tomorrow Is Yesterday", deux négociateurs chevronnés du Moyen-Orient, Robert Malley et Hussein Agha, estiment que l'attachement des diplomates à la solution à deux États pour résoudre le conflit israélo-palestinien est devenu une impasse. France 24 s'est entretenu avec Robert Malley.

title: “J’ai vendu ma dernière bague en or” : sans espoir, les réfugiés fuient Gaza-ville
summary: Alors que les bombardements israéliens s’intensifient sur la ville de Gaza, faisant de nombreux morts chaque jour, des milliers de réfugiés fuient la ville pour chercher un abri vers le sud. Notre Observateur Ahmed a encore une fois été déplacé. Depuis Deir al-Balah, il assiste aux arrivées quotidiennes de réfugiés.

title: Emmanuel Macron défend la reconnaissance d'un État palestinien à la télévision israélienne
summary: Emmanuel Macron a défendu jeudi la reconnaissance d'un État palestinien et la solution à deux États, dans une interview accordée à une chaîne de télévision israélienne. Le président de la République a condamné l'offensive à Gaza qui "détruit totalement" la "crédibilité" d'Israël.

title: Rwanda : les championnats du monde de cyclisme, vitrine du soft power de Paul Kagame
summary: La compétition, qui se déroule en Afrique pour la première fois de son histoire, est une nouvelle illustration des actions menées par Kigali pour valoriser son image sur les terrains sportif, diplomatique et sécuritaire.

title: En direct, Gaza : au moins 31 Palestiniens tués dans des bombardements et des tirs israéliens sur l’enclave depuis l’aube
summary: L’agence de presse palestinienne WAFa a fait état de bombardements, dimanche, sur plusieurs zones de la ville de Gaza, dont les quartiers de Sabra et Al-Daraj, ainsi que d’une explosion à Tel Al-Hawa, au sud-ouest de la ville, et de tirs israéliens près du corridor de Netzarim.

title: En direct, guerre en Ukraine : le conflit reflète la lutte du « bien contre le mal », estime l’émissaire américain Keith Kellogg
summary: Vladimir Poutine, « n’est pas un type bien. Et certaines des choses qu’il a faites sont absolument atroces », a déclaré, au quotidien anglais « The Telegraph », l’envoyé de Donald Trump. M. Kellogg n’imagine pas dans l’immédiat un quelconque accord de paix signé par le président russe.

title: « Meal trains » : quand les voisins se chargent du dîner pour soulager les jeunes parents
summary: « Darons d’ailleurs ». Deux fois par mois, un de nos journalistes à l’étranger explore la parentalité hors de nos frontières. Aux Etats-Unis, quand un bébé naît, grâce aux « trains de repas », les parents voient débarquer sur leur seuil des plats concoctés par leurs voisins et leurs amis.

title: Le plan américain pour expulser des centaines de milliers de Palestiniens de Gaza
summary: Le projet de transformation de la bande de Gaza en « Riviera du Moyen-Orient » prend forme et substance au sein de l’administration Trump, observe l’historien Jean-Pierre Filiu dans sa chronique.

title: Haoues Seniguer, politiste : « L’absence de solution politique dans le conflit israélo-palestinien fait le jeu d’un religieux ensauvagé »
summary: Alors que la religion est omniprésente au Proche-Orient, le professeur Haoues Seniguer analyse, dans un entretien au « Monde », comment certaines mouvances du judaïsme et de l’islam politisés sacralisent la violence au nom de Dieu, depuis les attaques du 7 octobre 2023 conduites par le Hamas et la riposte radicale d’Israël sur Gaza.

title: Etat de Palestine : la lente conversion d’Emmanuel Macron vers la reconnaissance
summary: Après un soutien initial sans faille à Israël, le président français a recentré sa position sur la solution à deux Etats. Une inflexion, opérée au fil de la guerre à Gaza, qui se concrétisera par la reconnaissance de la Palestine par la France à l’ONU, le 22 septembre.

title: En Guinée, un projet de Constitution accusé de permettre à Mamadi Doumbouya de se maintenir au pouvoir
summary: Contrairement à ce que prévoyait la « Charte de la transition » adoptée à la suite du coup d’Etat de 2021, le texte soumis à référendum ce dimanche ouvre la voie à une candidature du général putschiste à la magistrature suprême.

title: « Face au vent xénophobe, il faut considérer l’immigration comme une question non pas morale, mais économique et sociale »
summary: Aux Etats-Unis, au Royaume-Uni ou en France, la question migratoire a un caractère inflammable. Prétendre, comme le fait une partie de la gauche française, que l’ampleur de ce sujet résulte d’abord d’une instrumentalisation politicienne reflète une forme de cécité, affirme dans sa chronique Philippe Bernard, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Donald Trump met la pression sur l’Afghanistan pour récupérer la base militaire de Bagram
summary: Le président américain menace les talibans de « choses graves » en cas de non-restitution de cette base quittée par l’armée des Etats-Unis en 2021. Elle est située « à une heure de l’endroit où la Chine fabrique ses armes nucléaires », a-t-il expliqué.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : Kiev continue de viser des infrastructures pétrolières russes. Retrouvez les informations du 14 au 20 septembre
summary: L’Ukraine a frappé deux raffineries russes dans la nuit de vendredi à samedi, ainsi que des stations de pompage de pétrole du réseau de l’oléoduc Kouïbychevsk-Tikhoretsk, long de 881 km.

title: Malakoff : la justice administrative ordonne à la mairie de retirer le drapeau palestinien de son fronton, la maire entend le laisser jusqu’à mardi
summary: Plusieurs maires ont prévu de hisser le drapeau palestinien lundi, jour de la reconnaissance de l’Etat de Palestine. Le ministère de l’intérieur a demandé, vendredi, aux préfets de s’y opposer en saisissant la justice administrative.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • Gaza hospital officials say at least 91 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli strikes since dawn. According to the sources, 76 of the victims were in Gaza City, where bombardment has been heaviest.

  • Two new deaths have been recorded as a result of starvation and malnutrition in Gaza. This brings the total number of famine-related deaths to 442, including 147 children.

  • Approximately 270,000 residents of Gaza City have been forced to leave their homes under the pressure of Israeli bombardment since the launch of a deadly operation in mid-August, the Gaza government media office reported. 

  • Gaza’s Health Ministry has condemned Israel’s attempts to forcibly expel Palestinians from Gaza City, warning that hundreds of thousands remain trapped under siege.

  • Israel destroyed 75 percent of central wells in the besieged enclave, the Gaza municipality spokesperson Asim al-Nabih told Al Jazeera.

  • Children in Gaza are "bearing the heaviest burden", the United Nations Children's Fund (Unicef) said in a statement following the looting of four trucks on 18 September. 

  • Lebanese media say one person has been killed in an Israeli air strike that targeted a car in the Khardali area. The country’s official National News Agency identified the victim as a resident of Kfar Kila, a municipality in southern Lebanon.

  • Portugal will formally recognise a Palestinian state on Sunday, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on Friday. The declaration comes ahead of next week’s High-Level Conference.

  • Qatar has conditioned its return to mediation on the hostage deal on receiving an Israeli apology for a deadly attack in Doha, according to two sources who spoke to Israeli journalist Barak Ravid.

  • Germany’s culture minister has criticised threats by European countries to boycott next year’s Eurovision if Israel is allowed to take part, calling the move an attempt to politicise a cultural event.

title: Berlin concert highlights Gaza children killed in Israeli war
summary:
Berlin concert highlights Gaza children killed in Israeli war

Musicians in Berlin staged a classical concert on World Children’s Day to draw attention to the suffering of children killed in Israel’s war on Gaza.

The Music for Humanity initiative, which organised the performance, said the German capital was turned into “a place of solidarity, humanity, and music”.

Professional and amateur performers played both classical and traditional Arabic pieces, according to Anadolu news agency.

Organisers urged an immediate ceasefire, protection for children and civilians in Gaza, and an end to German weapons exports to Israel.

UNICEF estimates that since October 2023, more than 50,000 children have been killed or wounded in Gaza, with hundreds of thousands now facing life-threatening malnutrition.

title: Thousands in Vienna rally against Israel’s war on Gaza
summary:
Thousands in Vienna rally against Israel’s war on Gaza

Thousands of people filled the streets of Vienna to denounce Israel’s assault on Gaza, in one of the largest protests held in the Austrian capital since the war began.

The march, organised by more than 40 local organisations, wound its way to the Austrian parliament where demonstrators waved Palestinian flags and chanted: “Stop the genocide”, “Free Palestine”, and “Boycott Israel”.

Many carried banners listing the names of children killed under Israel’s bombardment of Gaza, turning the protest into both a rally and a memorial.

title: Freed Israeli-American captive to rejoin army and resume role in Gaza genocide
summary:
Freed Israeli-American captive to rejoin army and resume role in Gaza genocide

Former Hamas captive Idan Alexander, a 21-year-old Israeli-American soldier, has announced he will return to the Israeli army to take part in its ongoing genocide on Gaza.

"Next month I will return to Israel and once again wear my [Israeli army] uniform, serving proudly alongside my brothers. My story doesn't end with survival – it continues with service. Until victory," Alexander declared at a Friends of the Israel Defence Forces (FIDF) event in the United States earlier this week.

Alexander, who is also an American citizen said serving Israel is “one of the greatest honors of my life.”

The fundraising event for FIDF, a US based charity that supports Israeli soldiers, will fund emergency medical supplies and mental health treatment for those wounded in the occupied Palestinian territories.

Alexander was freed in May after Hamas said it would release him as a goodwill gesture to advance ceasefire talks and open the way for urgently needed humanitarian aid.

Read more: Freed Israeli-American captive to rejoin army and resume role in Gaza genocide

title: Freed Israeli-American captive to rejoin army and resume role in Gaza genocide
summary:
Freed Israeli-American captive to rejoin army and resume role in Gaza genocide

Submitted by Elis Gjevori on Sat, 09/20/2025 - 21:50
Released by Hamas in May, Idan Alexander's pledge comes as Israel’s assault has killed more than 65,000 Palestinians
Israeli-American captive Edan Alexander was serving as an Israeli soldiers when he was captured on 7 October 2023 (Social Media)
Off

Former Hamas captive Idan Alexander, a 21-year-old Israeli-American soldier, has announced he will return to the Israeli army to take part in its ongoing genocide on Gaza.

"Next month I will return to Israel and once again wear my [Israeli army] uniform, serving proudly alongside my brothers. My story doesn't end with survival – it continues with service. Until victory," Alexander declared at a Friends of the Israel Defence Forces (FIDF) event in the United States earlier this week.

Alexander, who is also an American citizen said serving Israel is “one of the greatest honors of my life.”

The fundraising event for FIDF, a US based charity that supports Israeli soldiers, will fund emergency medical supplies and mental health treatment for those wounded in the occupied Palestinian territories.

Alexander was freed in May after Hamas said it would release him as a goodwill gesture to advance ceasefire talks and open the way for urgently needed humanitarian aid.

“The movement affirms its readiness to immediately start intensive negotiations and make serious efforts to reach a final agreement to end the war, exchange prisoners in an agreed-upon manner,” Hamas official Khalil al-Hayya said at the time.

Why is the UN powerless in Gaza?
Read More »

US President Donald Trump welcomed the release on Truth Social, calling it “a step taken in good faith towards the United States and the efforts of the mediators - Qatar and Egypt - to put an end to this very brutal war and return ALL living hostages and remains to their loved ones.”

Washington’s special envoy to the Middle East, Steve Witkoff, also hailed the release, crediting Trump with playing a “central role” in securing Alexander’s freedom. “It is a big moment in large part because of Trump. The family is ecstatic,” Witkoff said.

Alexander, who holds dual US-Israeli citizenship, was serving in the Israeli military near Gaza when he was captured during the Hamas-led attack on southern Israel on 7 October.

Since Hamas’ gesture, the Trump administration has hardened its stance against Palestinians, backing the Israeli onslought on Gaza and promoting ethnic cleansing.

In August, a famine was officially declared in Gaza as Israel maintained its siege.

At least 65,208 Palestinians have been killed and 166,271 wounded in Israeli bombardments since October 2023, according to Gaza’s health authorities. Thousands more are believed to remain buried beneath the rubble of bombed-out neighbourhoods.

Israel's genocide in Gaza

title: Portugal to recognise Palestinian state ahead of EU summit
summary:
Portugal to recognise Palestinian state ahead of EU summit

Portugal will formally recognise a Palestinian state on Sunday, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs announced on Friday. The declaration comes ahead of next week’s High-Level Conference.

Foreign Minister Paulo Rangel had indicated earlier this week, during a visit to the UK, that Portugal was considering recognition.

Unlike Spain, which recognised Palestinian statehood in May 2024 alongside Ireland and Norway and urged other EU members to follow suit, Portugal has taken a more cautious path, seeking to coordinate a common position with its European partners first.

Only a few of the EU’s 27 members formally recognise Palestine, primarily former Communist states along with Sweden and Cyprus. The UN General Assembly granted Palestine “non-member state” status in November 2012, a form of de facto recognition.

title: Gaza health chief condemns forced expulsions amid Israeli strikes
summary:
Gaza health chief condemns forced expulsions amid Israeli strikes

Gaza’s Health Ministry has condemned Israel’s attempts to forcibly expel Palestinians from Gaza City, warning that hundreds of thousands remain trapped under siege.

“More than 900,000 remain steadfast and refuse to leave despite the ongoing bombardment and destruction,” Director-General Munir al-Bursh said.

He added: “The so-called ‘humanitarian zones’ are being used by the occupation to confine one million people in overcrowded areas with no water, no basic supplies, and no proper shelter.”

Al-Bursh said Israel had allocated only 12 percent of Gaza’s territory as shelter zones and was trying to cram at least 1.7 million people into these areas. “This amounts to a plan to create Nazi-like concentration camps of extermination, aiming to forcibly displace people into areas that lack the most basic conditions for life,” he warned.

title: Israeli attacks kill 91 Palestinians since dawn, say Gaza hospitals
summary:
Israeli attacks kill 91 Palestinians since dawn, say Gaza hospitals

Gaza hospital officials say at least 91 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli strikes since dawn. According to the sources, 76 of the victims were in Gaza City, where bombardment has been heaviest.

title: Germany slams Eurovision boycott threats over Israel’s participation
summary:
Germany slams Eurovision boycott threats over Israel’s participation

Germany’s culture minister has criticised threats by European countries to boycott next year’s Eurovision if Israel is allowed to take part, calling the move an attempt to politicise a cultural event.

Spain announced this week it would pull out of the contest scheduled for May if Israel participates, while Ireland, Slovenia, Iceland and the Netherlands have issued similar warnings.

“Eurovision was founded to bring nations together through music. Excluding Israel today goes against this fundamental idea and turns a celebration of understanding between peoples into a tribunal,” Wolfram Weimer said in a statement.

Austria, which will host the competition, expressed regret over the boycott threats on Friday. Belgium, Sweden and Finland are also considering whether to withdraw, with a final decision expected by December.

“Eurovision is based on the principle that artists are judged on their art and not on their nationality. The culture of cancellation is not the solution — the solution is diversity and cohesion,” Weimer added.

The European Broadcasting Union, which organises the contest, will decide in December if Israel will be allowed to compete in the 2026 edition.

Eurovision continues to draw massive audiences, with this year’s event in Basel attracting 166 million viewers across 37 countries.

The contest has increasingly been the focus of political tensions. Pro-Palestinian activists protested against Israel’s participation in Malmo in 2024 and again in Basel in May, as Israel pressed ahead with its war on Gaza.

title: From Israel to India: How Saudi-Pakistan defence pact is redrawing power lines
summary:
From Israel to India: How Saudi-Pakistan defence pact is redrawing power lines

Such was the magnitude of the security pact signed between Saudi Arabia and Pakistan this week that there was even a song released alongside it. 

“Pakistan and Saudi Arabia, brothers in faith,” the lyrics sang in Arabic. “An alliance of hearts and a single sword in the field.”

Just days after nearly 60 officials from Muslim-majority states met in Doha to jointly respond to Israel’s attack on the Qatari capital, a pact was agreed between these two “brothers in faith”. 

A Saudi official insisted that talks had been ongoing for years and the deal was not in response to specific countries or events. 

But the timing, days after Israel’s unprecedented strike on a Gulf country, is noteworthy. 

Read more: From Israel to India: How Saudi-Pakistan defence pact is redrawing power lines

title: Israeli strike kills one person in southern Lebanon: Report
summary:
Israeli strike kills one person in southern Lebanon: Report

Lebanese media say one person has been killed in an Israeli air strike that targeted a car in the Khardali area. The country’s official National News Agency identified the victim as a resident of Kfar Kila, a municipality in southern Lebanon.

The incident marks another violation of the ceasefire deal Israel reached with Hezbollah last November.

Just a day earlier, Israeli warplanes struck five towns in the south, drawing sharp condemnation from Lebanese officials, the army, and the United Nations.

title: Qatar seeks Israeli apology over Doha attack to resume mediation: Report
summary:
Qatar seeks Israeli apology over Doha attack to resume mediation: Report

Qatar has conditioned its return to mediation on the hostage deal on receiving an Israeli apology for a deadly attack in Doha, according to two sources who spoke to Israeli journalist Barak Ravid.

The demand reportedly came from Qatari Emir Sheikh Tamim al Thani and was raised during talks in Doha with US Secretary of State Marco Rubio on Tuesday.

An Israeli official admitted the fallout from the Doha attack was “more serious than Israel initially estimated”. A source familiar with the matter said Qatar may accept a carefully worded apology for the killing of a Qatari security officer, along with compensation for his family and assurances that its sovereignty would not be violated again.

For Netanyahu, however, issuing a formal apology would be politically explosive. A source noted that Qatari officials “understand the political complexities in Israel and are willing to be flexible about the wording”.

title: Women’s national handball team hold training session
summary: The Iranian women’s national handball team held their first training session in Tehran on Saturday, September 20, under the guidance of their Portuguese head coach Ana Cristiana Caeoura, as preparations begin for the World Championship.

title: IRGC warns adversaries of decisive response to any new aggression against Iran
summary: The IRGC issued the warning on the occasion of Sacred Defense Week, saying that the enemies, particularly the US and Israel, will receive a strong response if they make a new miscalculation.

title: VP Aref lauds Iran’s National Greco-Roman Wrestling Team’s championship in Zagreb
summary: First Vice President congratulated Iran’s National Greco-Roman Wrestling Team’s victory in Croatia.

title: Iran’s wrestling stars showcase national pride in Zagreb: Foreign Ministry spokesperson
summary: Baghaei said that the achievements extended beyond the simple gathering of medals, noting that Iranian wrestlers demonstrated the Iranian people’s strong will, dignity, and steadfastness.

title: Amnesty International calls for immediate sanctions on Israel
summary: Callamard said that Israel’s genocide in Gaza would not have been possible without the complicity and support of states, organizations, and companies.

title: 18th National Festival of Youth Music concluded
summary: The closing ceremony of the 18th National Festival of Youth Music took place on September 20, 2025, at Vahdat Hall, Tehran, where top performers were honored.

title: Head of Yemen's Supreme Political Council: We expected practical action from summit in Doha
summary: The head of the Supreme Political Council of Yemen said in a statement that "we expected practical action from the summit of Arab and Islamic leaders" in the capital of Qatar, instead of issuing a statement of condemnation.

title: Supreme National Security Council: Iran will suspend cooperation with IAEA
summary: The Supreme National Security Council in an important statement said that the ill-considered actions of three European countries regarding the Iranian nuclear issue, despite the cooperation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the Islamic Republic of Iran with the International Atomic Energy Agency and the presentation of plans to resolve the issue, will effectively suspend the path of cooperation with the Agency.

title: Exclusive | Russian expert: Security Council is advocate of Zionists
summary: A Russian political expert said that the vote in the Security Council on the draft resolution to prevent the return of sanctions on Iran was held under Western pressure and with an approach to supporting the Israeli regime.

title: General Staff of Iranian Armed Forces condemns Ecuador's listing of IRGC as terrorist organization
summary: The General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Islamic Republic of Iran strongly condemned the Ecuadorian government's despicable and illegal action of placing the Islamic Revolution Guards Corps on the list of terrorist organizations in a statement.

title: Iran opens the country’s largest coal mine rescue base in Tabas
summary: The facility, built on a 15,000-square-meter site with 4,200 square meters of indoor space, is designed to respond to mining accidents and improve safety standards across the sector.

title: Qeshm Island hosts second ‘Agricultural Nowruz’ festival
summary: The second “Agricultural Nowruz” festival was held in the village of Dayrestan on Qeshm Island to revive indigenous heritage and promote sustainable tourism through various traditional ceremonies and displays.

title: US bases protect Israeli regime, not Arab states
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – President of the Supreme Political Council in Sana’a says the American bases in the region are to protect the Israeli enemy not for Arab states of the region.

title: Two rockets fired from Gaza trigger sirens in Ashdod (+VIDEO)
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Israeli sources report that air raid sirens sounded in Ashdod following the launch of two rockets from the Gaza Strip, prompting settlers to flee to shelters.

title: UK set to recognize Palestinian state
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Sir Keir Starmer is expected to announce the UK's recognition of a Palestinian state in a statement on Sunday afternoon.

title: Venezuela popular forces ready to counter US threats
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro has announced that popular forces have been deployed across the country to counter any threat from "American aggressors".

title: Role of aid dependence in Sierra Leone’s vote against Iran
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Sierra Leone recently voted against the extension of lifting UN sanctions on Iran, a decision that may be linked to its heavy reliance on British development aid.

title: Global Sumud Flotilla to leave Italy for Gaza on Wednesday
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – The Global Sumud Flotilla will leave Italy for Gaza next Wednesday to break the blockade by sea.

title: 11 states to recognize independent Palestine ahead of UNGA
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Ahead of the 80th session of the UN General Assembly in New York, eleven countries have announced plans to officially recognize the State of Palestine, marking a significant diplomatic development amid the Gaza war.

title: Trump threatens Afghanistan with bad things on Bagram Airbase
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – US President Donald Trump on Saturday threatened Afghanistan with unspecified punishment if the Taliban-controlled country did not "give Bagram Airbase back."

title: Iran prepared to deliver decisive response to any aggression
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – The Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) in a statement stressed that any new miscalculation or aggression by adversaries will be met with decisive and exemplary retaliation.

title: In Sierra Leone, child labour leaves childhoods on hold
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Child labour in Sierra Leone is having a devastating impact on children’s rights, well-beings, and futures.

title: Iran’s strategic success in neutralizing sanctions
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 21 (MNA) – Despite Western pressure to activate the snapback mechanism against Iran, the nation's strategic focus on neutralizing sanctions via self-reliance has proven increasingly effective, rendering the measures largely unsuccessful.

title: Chabahar–Muscat shipping line to be launched next week
summary: TEHRAN, Sep. 20 (MNA) – Iran will inaugurate a new passenger shipping route between Chabahar and Muscat next week, following President Masoud Pezeshkian’s recent visit to Oman.

title: رصد و پایش ۴۸۵ واحد عرضه‌کننده آفت‌کش‌های کشاورزی در آذربایجان‌ غربی
summary: ارومیه - مدیر حفظ نباتات سازمان جهاد کشاورزی آذربایجان‌غربی از رصد و پایش ۴۸۵ واحد توزیع و عرضه‌کننده آفت‌کش‌های کشاورزی در استان طی مانور سراسری دو روزه خبر داد.

title: اجرای بیش از ۸۰ برنامه متنوع طی هفته دفاع مقدس در قشم
summary: بندرعباس- فرمانده سپاه ناحیه قشم از اجرای بیش از ۸۰ برنامه متنوع طی هفته دفاع مقدس شهرستان قشم و برپایی نمایشگاه «فاتحان قله» با محوریت نسل جدید خبر داد.

title: جایگزینی بیش از ۳۰۰ هزار مُهر تربت کربلا با مهرهای قدیمی حرم مطهر رضوی
summary: مشهد- مدیر عالی حرم مطهر رضوی گفت: مراسم تعویض بیش از ۳۰۰ هزار مُهر تربت کربلا با مهرهای حرم مطهر رضوی ظهر امروز شنبه ۲۹ شهریور، در مدرسه دو درب برگزار شد.

title: تهدیدات کاتس علیه رهبر انصار الله یمن دست‌مایه تمسخر شد
summary: منابع سیاسی و نظامی یمن با مضحک خواندن تهدیدات صهیونیست‌ها در ترور رهبر انصارالله و اشغال صنعا، تاکید کردند که یمن سلاح‌هایی دارد که هنوز رونمایی نشده است.

title: آتش‌سوزی در کارخانه فوم روستای «بیدگنه» ملارد مهار شد
summary: ملارد- مدیرعامل محترم سازمان آتش‌نشانی و خدمات ایمنی شهرداری ملارد از مهار آتش سوزی در کارخانه فوم روستای «بیدگنه» خبر داد.

title: آتش‌سوزی گسترده شرکت تولید فوم ملارد
summary: ملارد- دقایقی پیش، آتش‌سوزی مهیبی در یک واحد تولیدی فوم در روستای بیدگنه ملارد رخ داد که با انتشار دود غلیظ، نگرانی اهالی و توجه مسئولان محلی را برانگیخت.
